q: He was roundly criticized for his string of 40-point games as a rookie, accused of padding his stats in a push for the Rookie of the Year award-- which he won. Allen Iverson 's response this time: I don't mind taking 40 shots. That's what I do. `` I played that game like it was my last when I was a rookie and scored 50,'' said Allen Iverson , who equaled the most points scored in the NBA this season.`` I did the same

Katie Price , who has just split from husband Alex Reid, would face competition in the form of Robbie Williams , who is also being lined up to fill Simon Cowell 's place. A source said, Robbie Williams is a huge name so would naturally be a massive ratings hit. Not only that, he is also straight-talking and comical. We all understand that right now America is where Simon Cowell 's focus has to be. There aren't many people that can fill his shoes, but Robbie Williams just might be able to do it. Despite these rumours, there is currently nothing to suggest Simon Cowell will be leaving the show. As the LA natives met in London...

to speed up decision-making at the Internet giant. In a regulatory filing last week, Google said that Eric Schmidt in December drew up a plan to sell some of his stock in the company. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. As of December 31, Eric Schmidt had about 9.2 million shares of Google stock and controlled 9.6 percent of the company's voting power. Eric Schmidt plans to sell about 534,000 shares of Class

Spy''/> Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer has said that the Xbox 360 is not a games console. He told USA Today that its multimedia capabilities and Kinect support makes it an entertainment device. Xbox isn't a gaming console. Xbox is a family entertainment centre. It's a place to socialise, he said.`` It's a place to watch TV. We have Hulu coming. It's the only system where you are the controller. Your voice, your gestures, your body.''
